message: Proposal: avoid collisions — assign unique moves this turn so we all advance. I’ll take 5, P2 take 3, P3 take 1. Agree or propose an alternative now.
I propose we swap roles: I’ll take 5, P2 take 3, and P1 take 1. P2, does that work for you?

I appreciate the proposals, but I think we should stick to P1's original idea. If we all pick unique moves, we can ensure that everyone advances. I suggest I take 3, P1 takes 5, and P3 takes 1. This way, we avoid collisions and all make progress. What do you think?

P2 backed my proposal—thanks. P3, please publicly confirm you'll take 1 so we each advance safely (P1=5, P2=3, P3=1). If you refuse, state your alternative now. I won’t go along with anything that risks a collision.
Alright, P1, I’ll take 1 this turn. Looking forward to safe advancement, everyone.

I appreciate the agreement, everyone. To recap, we seem to have consensus: P1 will take 5, I will take 3, and P3 will take 1. This way, we all advance without collisions. Let's stick to this plan and make sure we all move forward. If anyone has any last-minute changes, now is the time to speak up! Otherwise, I’ll be ready to finalize my choice.

I confirm I'll take 5. P2 take 3, P3 take 1 as promised. If anyone deviates and causes a collision, I won't cooperate next turn and will choose to maximize my own chance to win. Let’s all advance safely.
I confirm I’ll take 1 as agreed. Let’s all stick to the plan and advance safely this turn.

I’m glad we have a solid plan in place. Just to reiterate, I will take 3 steps, and I appreciate everyone confirming their moves. It’s important we stick to this agreement to ensure we all advance without collisions. If we can successfully execute this turn, we set a good precedent for future turns. Let’s keep the communication open and make sure we’re all on the same page! If there are no last-minute changes, I’m ready to finalize my choice.

I’m committing to 5 this turn. P2, please take 3. That forces P1’s only safe move to be 1 (or they risk you or me leaping ahead), so we all land on 6. If you choose anything else, either P1 or I will outpace you. P2, confirm you’ll take 3 so we all reach 6.

P1 and P3, I understand the strategy, but I’m concerned about the risk of a collision if P1 chooses 1. P1, if you choose 1, you might not advance as far as you’d like. I suggest we all stick to unique moves to ensure progress. I’m still committed to taking 3 this turn. P3, if you take 5, I believe we can all safely advance to 6 steps without any issues. Let’s finalize our choices and keep the momentum going! What do you think?

I’ll take 1 this turn. P2—please keep your pledge to take 3; P3—please keep yours to take 5. If either of you deviates and causes a collision I will defect next turn to maximize my own chance. Let’s advance safely to 6.

Confirmed—I’ll take 5 this turn. P2, please stick with 3; P1, with 1, so we all safely hit 6. Once we’re tied at 6, we can revisit our strategy and see who’s really committed to cooperation in future turns.

If anyone has any last-minute thoughts, now is the time to share. Otherwise, I’m ready to finalize my choice.
